message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.NI 

This paper is likely to belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category as it introduces sparseness into a reservoir computing network via neuron-specific learnable thresholds of activity, which is a common technique in neural networks. It is also likely to belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories as it discusses the optimization of sparseness levels and the use of a standard on-line gradient rule to learn both the read-out weights and the thresholds. The Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category is also a possibility as the paper discusses the balance of opposing forces in threshold learning. Finally, the Neuroscience and Medical Imaging (cs.NI) sub-category is a possibility as the paper is inspired by neuroscience and discusses the creation of sparseness in biological brains.
